results.title: Statin Effects on Aggression: Results from the UCSD Statin Study, a Randomized Control Trial
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ increased @<m>DISEASE_Personality_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010554 @@@aggression@@@ more strongly in those with @<m>DISEASE_Personality_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010554 @@@aggression@@@ >0 at baseline.

citations.NLM: Golomb BA, Dimsdale JE, Koslik HJ, Evans MA, Lu X, Rossi S, Mills PJ, White HL, Criqui MH. Statin Effects on Aggression: Results from the UCSD Statin Study, a Randomized Control Trial PLoS One. 2015;10(7):e0124451. PMID: 26132393
citations.BibTeX: @article{26132393, title={Statin Effects on Aggression: Results from the UCSD Statin Study, a Randomized Control Trial}, author={Golomb BA and Dimsdale JE and Koslik HJ and Evans MA and Lu X and Rossi S and Mills PJ and White HL and Criqui MH}, journal={PLoS One}, volume={10}, number={7}, pages={e0124451}}

results.title: [Correlation between the eicosapentaenoic acid, docosahexaenoic acid and the aggressive behavior in mice].
results.text_hl: The control group, @CHEMICAL_Fish_Oils @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005395 @@@fish oil@@@ group and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ group were given normal saline, @CHEMICAL_Fish_Oils @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005395 @@@fish oil@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ by irrigation respectively for 3 months consecutively, each @SPECIES_10090 @@@mouse@@@ was raised isolatedly.

citations.NLM: Liu C, Cai WX. [Correlation between the eicosapentaenoic acid, docosahexaenoic acid and the aggressive behavior in mice]. Fa Yi Xue Za Zhi. 2011 Apr;27(2):120-4. PMID: 21604451
citations.BibTeX: @article{21604451, title={[Correlation between the eicosapentaenoic acid, docosahexaenoic acid and the aggressive behavior in mice].}, author={Liu C and Cai WX}, journal={Fa Yi Xue Za Zhi}, volume={27}, number={2}, pages={120-4}}

results.title: The UCSD Statin Study: a randomized controlled trial assessing the impact of statins on selected noncardiac outcomes.
results.text_hl: Secondary outcomes include mood (CES-D and Wakefield @DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder @DISEASE_MESH:D003866 @@@depression@@@ inventory), quality of life (SF-12V), sleep (Leeds sleep scale, modified), and secondary @<m>DISEASE_Personality_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010554 @@@aggression@@@ measures (Conflict Tactics Scale; Overt @<m>DISEASE_Personality_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010554 @@@Aggression@@@ Scale, Modified).

citations.NLM: Golomb BA, Criqui MH, White HL, Dimsdale JE. The UCSD Statin Study: a randomized controlled trial assessing the impact of statins on selected noncardiac outcomes. Control Clin Trials. 2004 Apr;25(2):178-202. PMID: 15020036
citations.BibTeX: @article{15020036, title={The UCSD Statin Study: a randomized controlled trial assessing the impact of statins on selected noncardiac outcomes.}, author={Golomb BA and Criqui MH and White HL and Dimsdale JE}, journal={Control Clin Trials}, volume={25}, number={2}, pages={178-202}}
